info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 2:28PM CDT until April 22 at 7:40PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Missouri...
Spring River above Baxter Springs affecting Cherokee County.
Spring River near Waco affecting Jasper County.
Spring River at Carthage affecting Jasper County.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...
Elk River near Tiff City affecting McDonald County.
For the Spring River...including Carthage, Waco, Baxter Springs... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Spring River at Carthage.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, minor flooding occurs at the gage site. Flood waters impact State Highway 37 east of Carthage between Avilla and Reeds.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM CDT Monday was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 230 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING
